summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jes Staley and other individuals discussing public relations strategies related to Staley's role as CEO. The conversation touches on media appearances and the impact of print versus television interviews, particularly in the context of criticism faced by bank CEOs attending the Davos conference.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is discussing his public relations strategy and media appearances as the new CEO.

persons.name: Kristin C Lemkau
persons.context: Kristin Lemkau advises Jes Staley against doing a TV interview from Davos and suggests focusing on print media instead.

persons.name: Joseph Evangelisti
persons.context: Joseph Evangelisti is included in the email chain discussing media strategies.

persons.name: Lionel
persons.context: Lionel is mentioned as someone who can influence the media narrative during the Davos conference.

persons.name: Robert
persons.context: Robert is mentioned alongside Lionel as someone who can help with media strategies.

persons.name: Matt Tames
persons.context: Matt Tames is mentioned as having spent time with a journalist discussing a major story related to the Obama proposal.

persons.name: Kate Kelly
persons.context: Kate Kelly from the Wall Street Journal is mentioned as working on a major story that Jes Staley is encouraged to be quoted in.

connections.description: Kristin Lemkau is providing PR advice to Jes Staley in his capacity as CEO.
Joseph Evangelisti is included in the email discussions regarding media strategies.
Lionel is mentioned as an advisor who can help Jes Staley with media influence.
Robert is mentioned alongside Lionel as someone who can assist Jes Staley.
Matt Tames has discussed a major story with journalist Kate Kelly.

keyFacts: Jes Staley is advised against doing a TV interview from Davos due to negative press surrounding bank CEOs.
Kristin Lemkau emphasizes the importance of print media over television for Staley's first interview as CEO.
Matt Tames and Kristin Lemkau are involved in discussions about media strategies and potential quotes for a major story.
